files.models module¶

class files.models.FileInfo(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

A model that stores information about files including metadata such as file name, size, extension, and additional properties like image dimensions, PDF pages, and EXIF data.

run_id¶

A unique identifier for the run that collected this file’s information.

Type:

str

name¶

The name of the file.

Type:

str

path¶

The full path where the file is located.

Type:

str

size¶

The size of the file in bytes.

Type:

int

extension¶

The file’s extension (e.g., ‘.jpg’, ‘.pdf’, etc.).

Type:

str

created_at¶

The creation date and time of the file.

Type:

datetime

modified_at¶

The last modified date and time of the file.

Type:

datetime

width¶

The width of the image if the file is an image (in pixels).

Type:

int, optional

height¶

The height of the image if the file is an image (in pixels).

Type:

int, optional

area¶

The area of the image if it’s an image, calculated as width * height (in square pixels).

Type:

int, optional

dpi¶

The DPI (dots per inch) of the image if applicable.

Type:

int, optional

exif_data¶

The EXIF data for images, stored as a JSON string.

Type:

str, optional

pages¶

The number of pages in the file if it is a document (e.g., PDF).

Type:

int, optional

format¶

The format of the file, such as ‘text/plain’, ‘image/jpeg’, etc.

Type:

str, optional

orientation¶

The orientation of the image, such as ‘landscape’ or ‘portrait’.

Type:

str, optional

files.views module¶

files.views.error(request)[source]¶

Displays the error page with the total size of all files. This is shown when no valid scan run exists or an error occurs during processing.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Renders the ‘error.html’ template with error information.

Return type:

HttpResponse

files.views.extension(request)[source]¶

Displays statistics about file extensions for the last scan run. Retrieves the total size of all files and the size of files from the last run. Also gathers statistics on the number of occurrences of each file extension.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Renders the ‘extension.html’ template with the relevant statistics.

Return type:

HttpResponse

files.views.get_last_run_id(request)[source]¶

Retrieves the last run ID from the session.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The run ID from the session, or None if no run ID is found.

Return type:

str or None

files.views.image(request)[source]¶

Displays statistics for image files, specifically focusing on the top images by area. Retrieves the total size of all files and the total size from the last scan, and also displays the top 10 images by area (width x height).

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Renders the ‘image.html’ template with image statistics.

Return type:

HttpResponse

files.views.index(request)[source]¶

Handles the index page, allowing for file scanning and showing the total file size. If the request method is POST, it starts the scanning process for the specified folder. The folder path must be provided, and if it is valid, the scanning process is initiated.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Returns a JSON response on POST with scan results or errors, or renders the ‘index.html’ template with total size information.

Return type:

JsonResponse or HttpResponse

files.views.pdf(request)[source]¶

Displays statistics for PDF files, specifically focusing on the top documents by page count. Retrieves the total size of all files and the total size from the last scan, and also displays the top 10 PDF files with the most pages.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Renders the ‘pdf.html’ template with PDF statistics.

Return type:

HttpResponse

files.views.size(request)[source]¶

Displays statistics for the largest files, focusing on the top 10 largest files by size. Retrieves the total size of all files and the total size from the last scan, and also displays the top 10 largest files.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Renders the ‘size.html’ template with size statistics.

Return type:

HttpResponse
